intro: Aphanes maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan sandweed, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring, and its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs. Aphanes maroccana is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access moisture. It plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and rocky habitats.
